alert.note: Alert for Decatur (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 12 at 2:33PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CDT/430 PM EDT/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Florida and southwest Georgia, including the following counties, in Florida, Calhoun, Gadsden, Jackson, Leon, Liberty and Wakulla. In southwest Georgia, Decatur. * WHEN...Until 330 PM CDT /430 PM EDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 132 PM CDT /232 PM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Blountstown, Quincy, Greensboro, Chattahoochee, Orange, Gretna, Bristol, Hosford, Lowry, Telogia, Clio, Juniper, Rock Bluff, Roy, Sycamore, Woods, Torreya State Park, Sawdust, Bloxham and Wetumpka. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
